Most Illustrious Sir

The citizen Antônio José de Abreu states that it becomes necessary for the respective clerk, in view of the records of the collection of the assets of the deceased intestate José Augusto Ledek, to provide him with a certificate of the order in which the Petitioner was appointed Guardian of the dormant estate of said deceased, the day, month, and year in which he took the oath, as well as the day and year in which said assets were deposited in the hands of Major Bernardo Pires, and finally the order by which the Petitioner was relieved of the office of Guardian.

He requests from Your Lordship

I expect to receive from Your Grace

Pass. Piratini, October 2, 1841. Freitas

No. 2 The citizen Antônio Belarmino Ribeiro, Clerk of Orphans and Absentees of the city of Piratini and its district. By virtue of the aforementioned order: I certify that the assets referred to by the petitioner were deposited in the possession of citizen Major Bernardo Pires on the twenty-fourth of last September, as shown in the records on page eleven. Further, I certify, and it appears in the same records on page fourteen, that the petitioner was appointed Guardian and took the oath on the twenty-fifth of said month of September. Finally, I certify that in the aforesaid records on page twenty-one verso it appears that the petitioner was relieved from such guardianship on the first day of the current month of October and replaced by the aforementioned citizen Major Bernardo Pires. The foregoing is true and I refer to the pertinent records. Antônio Belarmino Ribeiro
